title: UK weather: Drivers trapped in flooded cars rescued in torrential rain chaos
text:

Drivers trapped in stranded cars have had to be rescued by the emergency services after heavy rain caused widespread flooding today.

West Mercia Police have warned motorists to 'only travel if necessary'.

Flooding has been reported in built-up areas across the UK and a yellow weather warning has been issued by the Met Office as stormy weather hits.

In Cornwall, firefighters were called to a property in Warbstow Cross after a river burst its banks bringing chaos to residents.

And more rain is expected to fall over the next 24 hours for parts of the north west of England and Wales.

(Image: cheshire-live.co.uk/)

(Image: cheshire-live.co.uk/)

Several roads in south Wales have been closed due to flooding and nearly two dozen flood warnings, issued by Natural Resources Wales, remain in effect across the south of the country.

In addition to the 80 flood alerts in force, the Environment Agency has also issued 194 flood alerts - where flooding is not expected but possible across the UK.

It's a similar story across parts of Cheshire and the West Midlands, reports Birmingham Live.

A spokesman for West Mercia Police said: said: "We are experiencing a high volume of calls due to the weather. Many roads throughout the West Mercia policing area are flooded or closed. Please travel only if necessary and drive to suit the weather conditions."

(Image: cheshire-live.co.uk/)

(Image: cheshire-live.co.uk/)

West Midlands Fire Service is reminding drivers not to try to drive through flood water.

East Midlands Trains and Northern Trains in Cheshire have either been delayed, cancelled or are running with a rail replacement bus service.

In Warbstow Cross, firefighters were called shortly before midnight on Friday, October 25.

(Image: birminghammail.co.uk)

A spokesperson for Cornwall Fire and Rescue Service said: "Two rooms in the property were flooded with 150mm of water and the electrics were affected.

"Crews used a light portable pump and small gear at this incident".

Strong winds have also downed trees, while power in almost 250 homes was cut off in homes across Cornwall on Saturday morning.

Weather desk advisor Robert Springett said there are "a number of warnings" in place across the UK.

(Image: birminghammail.co.uk)

(Image: cheshire-live.co.uk/)

The Met Office says: "Rain is expected during Friday and Saturday and this is likely to be heavy over high ground, particularly parts of Dartmoor, Exmoor and Bodmin Moor.

"Many places within the warning area will see relatively small amounts - 5-10 mm of rain, but over high ground some places may see 80-90 mm.

"This will be accompanied by strong winds which could reach 50 mph over coasts and hills."
description: West Mercia Police have warned motorists to 'only travel if necessary' as heavy rains cause widespread chaos across the country
